intro: Englerodendron nigericum, commonly known as blackwood or black elder, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its dark, woody stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Englerodendron nigericum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
